title: Security Advisory for Java artifacts hosted at the Maven central repository
description: Security Advisory for Java artifacts hosted at the Maven central repository on GitHub

items.content_html:
Keycloak was found to not properly enforce token types when validating signatures locally. An authenticated attacker could use this flaw to exchange a logout token for an access token and possibly gain access to data outside of enforced permissions.

References

  • https://github.com/keycloak/keycloak/security/advisories/GHSA-7fpj-9hr8-28vh
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-7fpj-9hr8-28vh
items.title: [org.keycloak:keycloak-services] Keycloak vulnerable to impersonation via logout token exchange

items.content_html:
Keycloak was found to not properly enforce token types when validating signatures locally. An authenticated attacker could use this flaw to exchange a logout token for an access token and possibly gain access to data outside of enforced permissions.

References

  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-7fpj-9hr8-28vh
items.title: [org.keycloak:keycloak-services] Keycloak vulnerable to impersonation via logout token exchange

items.content_html:
A flaw was found in Keycloak. An active keycloak session can be hijacked by initiating a new authentication (having the query parameter prompt=login) and forcing the user to enter his credentials once again. If the user cancels this re-authentication by clicking Restart login, the account takeover could take place as the new session, with a different SUB, will have the same SID as the previous session.

References

  • https://github.com/keycloak/keycloak/security/advisories/GHSA-c9h6-v78w-52wj
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-c9h6-v78w-52wj
items.title: [org.keycloak:keycloak-services] Keycloak vulnerable to session hijacking via re-authentication

items.content_html:

An active keycloak session can be hijacked by initiating a new authentication (having the query parameter prompt=login) and forcing the user to enter his credentials once again. items.title: [org.keycloak:keycloak-services] Keycloak vulnerable to session hijacking via re-authentication

items.content_html:
A flaw was found in Keycloak, where it does not properly validate URLs included in a redirect. An attacker can use this flaw to construct a malicious request to bypass validation and access other URLs and potentially sensitive information within the domain or possibly conduct further attacks. This flaw affects any client that utilizes a wildcard in the Valid Redirect URIs field.

Acknowledgements:

Special thanks to Axel Flamcourt for reporting this issue and helping us improve our project.

References

  • https://github.com/keycloak/keycloak/security/advisories/GHSA-72vp-xfrc-42xm
  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-1132
  • https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2024:1868
  • https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2024-1132
  • https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2262117
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-72vp-xfrc-42xm
items.title: [org.keycloak:keycloak-services] Keycloak path transversal vulnerability in redirection validation

items.content_html:
A potential security flaw in the "checkLoginIframe" which allows unvalidated cross-origin messages, enabling potential DDoS attacks. By exploiting this vulnerability, attackers could coordinate to send millions of requests in seconds using simple code, significantly impacting the application's availability without proper origin validation for incoming messages.

Acknowledgements

Special thanks to Adriano MÃ¡rcio Monteiro from BRZTEC for reporting this issue and helping us improve our project.

References

  • https://github.com/keycloak/keycloak/security/advisories/GHSA-m6q9-p373-g5q8
  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-1249
  • https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2024:1868
  • https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2024-1249
  • https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2262918
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-m6q9-p373-g5q8
items.title: [org.keycloak:keycloak-services] Keycloak's unvalidated cross-origin messages in checkLoginIframe leads to DDoS

items.content_html:
A potential security flaw in the "checkLoginIframe" which allows unvalidated cross-origin messages, enabling potential DDoS attacks. By exploiting this vulnerability, attackers could coordinate to send millions of requests in seconds using simple code, significantly impacting the application's availability without proper origin validation for incoming messages.

Acknowledgements

Special thanks to Adriano MÃ¡rcio Monteiro from BRZTEC for reporting this issue and helping us improve our project.

items.title: [org.keycloak:keycloak-services] Keycloak's unvalidated cross-origin messages in checkLoginIframe leads to DDoS

items.content_html:
A flaw was found in keycloak 22.0.5. Errors in browser client during setup/auth with "Security Key login" (WebAuthn) are written into the form, send to Keycloak and logged without escaping allowing log injection.

Acknowledgements: Special thanks toTheresa Henze for reporting this issue and helping us improve our security.

References

  • https://github.com/keycloak/keycloak/security/advisories/GHSA-j628-q885-8gr5
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-j628-q885-8gr5
items.title: [org.keycloak:keycloak-services] Keycloak vulnerable to log Injection during WebAuthn authentication or registration

items.content_html:

items.title: [org.keycloak:keycloak-services] Keycloak vulnerable to log Injection during WebAuthn authentication or registration

items.content_html:
Versions of the BlazeMeter Jenkins plugin prior to 4.22 contain a flaw which results in credential enumeration.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-3825
  • https://github.com/Blazemeter/blazemeter-jenkins-plugin/commit/11ec94f68136a0612ae1b37b5370053132cb2528
  • https://portal.perforce.com/s/detail/a91PA000001STsvYAG
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-r52h-fjm7-93j8
items.title: [com.blazemeter.plugins:BlazeMeterJenkinsPlugin] BlazeMeter Jenkins plugin vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery

items.content_html:
Due to a permissive regular expression hardcoded for filtering allowed hosts to register a dynamic client, a malicious user with enough information about the environment could benefit and jeopardize an environment with this specific Dynamic Client Registration with TrustedDomain configuration previously unauthorized.

Acknowledgements:

Special thanks to Bastian Kanbach for reporting this issue and helping us improve our security.

References

  • https://github.com/keycloak/keycloak/security/advisories/GHSA-46c8-635v-68r2
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-46c8-635v-68r2
items.title: [org.keycloak:keycloak-services] Keycloak Authorization Bypass vulnerability

items.content_html:
Due to a permissive regular expression hardcoded for filtering allowed hosts to register a dynamic client, a malicious user with enough information about the environment could benefit and jeopardize an environment with this specific Dynamic Client Registration with TrustedDomain configuration previously unauthorized.

Acknowledgements:

Special thanks to Bastian Kanbach for reporting this issue and helping us improve our security.

References

  • https://github.com/keycloak/keycloak/security/advisories/GHSA-46c8-635v-68r2
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-46c8-635v-68r2
items.title: [org.keycloak:keycloak-services] Keycloak Authorization Bypass vulnerability

items.content_html:
Keycloak allows arbitrary URLs as SAML Assertion Consumer Service POST Binding URL (ACS), including JavaScript URIs (javascript:).

Allowing JavaScript URIs in combination with HTML forms leads to JavaScript evaluation in the context of the embedding origin on form submission.

Acknowledgements:

Special thanks to Lauritz Holtmann for reporting this issue and helping us improve our project.

References

  • https://github.com/keycloak/keycloak/security/advisories/GHSA-8rmm-gm28-pj8q
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-8rmm-gm28-pj8q
items.title: [org.keycloak:keycloak-services] Keycloak Cross-site Scripting (XSS) via assertion consumer service URL in SAML POST-binding flow

items.title: [org.keycloak:keycloak-services] Keycloak Cross-site Scripting (XSS) via assertion consumer service URL in SAML POST-binding flow

items.content_html:
Keycloak does not correctly validate its client step-up authentication. A password-authed attacker could use this flaw to register a false second auth factor, alongside the existing one, to a targeted account. The second factor then permits step-up authentication.

References

  • https://github.com/keycloak/keycloak/security/advisories/GHSA-4f53-xh3v-g8x4
  • https://github.com/keycloak/keycloak/commit/aa634aee882892960a526e49982806e103c8a432
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-4f53-xh3v-g8x4
items.title: [org.keycloak:keycloak-services] Keycloak secondary factor bypass in step-up authentication

items.content_html:

items.title: [org.keycloak:keycloak-services] Keycloak secondary factor bypass in step-up authentication

items.content_html:
An issue was found in the redirect_uri validation logic that allows for a bypass of otherwise explicitly allowed hosts.

References

  • https://github.com/keycloak/keycloak/security/advisories/GHSA-mrv8-pqfj-7gp5
  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-2419
  • https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2024-2419
  • https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2269371
  • https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2024:1867
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-mrv8-pqfj-7gp5
items.title: [org.keycloak:keycloak-services] Keycloak path traversal vulnerability in the redirect validation

items.content_html:
Apache POI before 3.10.1 and 3.11.x before 3.11-beta2 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption and crash) via a crafted OOXML file, aka an XML Entity Expansion (XEE) attack.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2014-3574
  • https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/95768
  • https://lucene.apache.org/solr/solrnews.html#18-august-2014-recommendation-to-update-apache-poi-in-apache-solr-480-481-and-490-installations
  • http://poi.apache.org/changes.html
  • http://rhn.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2014-1370.html
  • http://rhn.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2014-1398.html
  • http://rhn.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2014-1399.html
  • http://rhn.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2014-1400.html
  • http://www-01.ibm.com/support/docview.wss?uid=swg21996759
  • http://www.apache.org/dist/poi/release/RELEASE-NOTES.txt
  • https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/poi/branches/REL_3_10_BRANCH@1616509
  • https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/poi/trunk@1615720
  • https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/poi/trunk@1615731
  • https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/poi/trunk@1615781
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-5wfp-8643-c58x
items.title: [org.apache.poi:poi] Improper Input Validation in Apache POI
